title: Calories in Bone-In Pork Chops
meta_description: Discover calories pork chops bone in, including per chop nutrition facts like protein, fat, carbs, and tips for variations to fit your diet.
assumptions: Bone-in pork loin chop, broiled without added fat; lean only, edible portion ~85 g; standard thickness (1-inch).
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by cut, cooking method, fat trimming, and portion size. Consult labels or USDA data for specifics.

quick_answer.text: One bone-in pork chop provides ~197 kcal and 24 g protein.

basis.label: per 1 bone-in pork chop (~85 g edible)

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison with packaging.

faqs.q: How many calories in one bone-in pork chop?
faqs.a: Approximately 197 kcal for a broiled 85 g edible portion.

faqs.q: What's the protein in bone-in pork chops?
faqs.a: About 24 g protein per chop, making it a lean meat option.

faqs.q: Do bone-in pork chops have carbs?
faqs.a: No carbs, fiber, or sugars in plain cooked bone-in pork chops.

faqs.q: How does cooking method affect calories in pork chops bone in?
faqs.a: Broiling or grilling keeps calories lower; frying adds 40+ kcal from oil.

faqs.q: Are bone-in pork chops higher in fat than boneless?
faqs.a: Similar if lean; bone-in may include more fat if not trimmed, around 10.4 g total fat per chop.
